tool_description: Performs multi-element geochemical analysis using various analytical techniques (XRF, ICP-MS, ICP-AES) to determine elemental concentrations in prepared samples.

sample_id.description: Unique identifier for the prepared sample

analytical_method.description: Analytical technique: XRF, ICP_MS, ICP_AES, or multi_method

elements_to_analyze.description: List of chemical elements to analyze

sample_weight_g.description: Weight of sample aliquot in grams

run_duplicates.description: Whether to run duplicate analyses for precision

detection_limit_mode.description: Detection limit calculation: standard, enhanced, or ultra_low

measurement_replicates.description: Number of measurement replicates per sample

error_messages: Sample not prepared: The sample must be prepared before analysis.
Invalid analytical_method: Use one of [XRF, ICP_MS, ICP_AES, multi_method].
Invalid elements: Provide valid chemical element symbols (e.g., Au, Cu, Fe, Si).
Insufficient sample_weight_g: Must be between 0.1 and 100 grams.
Missing calibration standards: At least one reference standard is required.
Invalid detection_limit_mode: Use one of [standard, enhanced, ultra_low].
Invalid measurement_replicates: Must be between 1 and 10.
Analysis date error: Date cannot be in the future and must be valid ISO 8601 format.
usage: Provide sample_id, analytical_method, elements_to_analyze, sample_weight_g, calibration_standards, analysis_date, and operator_id; optionally set run_duplicates, detection_limit_mode, matrix_correction, blank_correction, and measurement_replicates.

element_concentrations.description: Measured concentrations for each element with units

detection_limits.description: Detection limits for each element with units

analytical_uncertainty.description: Measurement uncertainty percentages for each element

quality_flags.description: Quality control flags for each measurement
